clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Efficacy of the Suppository Versus Guaiacol Suppository Versus Guaifenesin Syrup in Pediatric Patients With Cough Due the Infectious Origin
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Efficacy of the Suppository Composed by Guaiacol, Eucalyptol, Menthol and Camphor Versus Guaiacol Suppository Versus Guaifenesin Syrup in Pediatric Patients With Cough Due the Infectious Origin

brief_summary.textblock: It is believed that the suppository consisting of guaiacol, menthol, camphor and eucalyptol, by their pharmacological properties already established for each component, has the ability to reduce the signs and symptoms related to upper respiratory infections in a manner equivalent (not inferior) to medicine used as a comparator in this study and higher than the suppository containing only guaiacol concentration of 12.5 mg.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of cough of infectious origin.
primary_outcome.description: During visits (V1, V2, V3 and V4) will be assessed the signs of improvement of cough of infectious origin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of parameters for the improvement of infectious cough.
secondary_outcome.description: During visits (V1, V2, V3 and V4) will be assessed the signs of improvement in difficulty in breathing,quality of sleep,nasal obstruction, food intake and adherence to the treatment.

arm_group.description: Suppository composed by guaiacol, eucalyptol, menthol and camphor

intervention.intervention_name: Guaiacol, eucalyptol, menthol and camphor suppository
